Reviews.Title: “Cheapie but a goodie”
Reviews.Author: tiffany d
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location - bus across the street and MRT within easy walk. Walk to Bugis markets and pretty much everything else. Small rooms but clean amd cheap and friendly staff. Great buffet breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but the pleasant service made all the difference”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about this being an older hotel. The rooms were small but clean. Bed was comfortable enough. What made it for me was the pleasant service. I had a very early flight and they even prepared a sandwich and a bottle of fruit juice to take with me and helped me hail a taxi. Not luxurious but felt welcome. value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It WAS a glorious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harry2030101
Reviews.Content: I was in a hurry when I booked this hotel. It was a sudden booking. Since the location and the price seems good, I booked this hotel just 1 day before. I was quite excited when I know this hotel location was a prime location. But when I checked-in, I was stunned by the un-friendliness of the front office staff. She asked for my passport, as if I had been a visitor from an isolated island. She just said "PASSPORT!" "PASSPORT!", meanwhile I greeted her and spoke to her with my very good articulated English. I was quite amazed when she gave me a metal key, instead of the Key Card. In this time?? The hotel with high floors building? Still using the metal key? that's very un-secure, isn't it? Well the rooms: The door couldn't be opened full since the alley for the door was too narrow. The furniture were very old and worn out. They need a total refurbished. The carpet real color is already un-noticeable since it was very very worn out and too old. At the first time, I was quite entertained by the new LCD tv installed on the wall, but oh no...they only have 3-4 local channels, news the whole time and no satellite channels at all. Some of the channels were even scrambled. When I was about to use the free wifi, as told in their compendium book, I was asked the password. Then I called the operator asking about it. Gosh I was waited for more than 5 minutes by the operator, just to tell me back the internet was not actually free of charge. And I have to buy voucher to use the wifi facilities. The Air con sometimes works very well especially at night, until it is freezing. But sometimes not working at all. Luckily I spent a lot of time outside the hotel. The bathroom : It was a luxurious hotel for the late 80's. Not for now. It is already outdated with further renovation. They have big toilet bowl that can't be flushed, outdated bath tube with unstable hot water supply. The circulation in the bathroom was very bad, so if you used the toilet bowl to do the No.1, the odor will stay there for quite a long time. Disgusting. Well actually there is a positive thing about this hotel.Even the restaurant was quite tiny, with very limited tables, with quite limited choices of menu, the served quite delicious dishes. And as mentioned above again, the restaurant need total renovation, it seemed like the end of the 80's restaurant, with gloomy wall and old decoration. Luckily the location was good. Getting taxi is an easy things, Food and supermarkets were around the area. Getting everywhere from this location was easy. The conclusion is : If you don't expect the a new nicer hotel, and only use this hotel for sleeping and keep your eyes closed for the facilities, because you are aftering for good location. this hotel is your you.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard room is very very small”
Reviews.Author: astiarjan
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel...it was on Feb 1-2, 2012. I was staying in standard room and it is very small room. Cleanliness is OK, location is OK, you can go to Bugis Junction and nearby MRT station is Bugis. Accessibility is good and worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Conbrucious
Reviews.Content: The rooms are out of date and have a musty smell (carpets). We booked it for a layover in April for $80pn (5 people/2 rooms). When we get there the price jumped to $80pp and they called it a "Festive Season Surcharge". As it was Xmas we had no choice. The food, and the restaurant was well below standard. At least some of the staff were nice. Please go somewhere else, you've been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but very small room!”
Reviews.Author: SusanJH11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok, clean and comfortable with very helpful staff, important when in a strange city. Very safe area, (although I suspect most of Singapore is), lots of people out walking in the evenings. Good selection of shops, restaurants nearby. If only there for a day or two, as we were, best to book a city tour which stops at places of interest for photos, as it's too far to walk to most of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: The_Lovecats5
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a few nights whilst we were in Singapore. Great location. Very close to the Bugis St Markets, and Bugis MRT station.Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Quite costly for the small room on a noisy street but there was more good than bad. Always clean and a nice place to rest your head at night.

Reviews.Title: “Summer View of Bugis :-)”
Reviews.Author: honeylegs
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore on a business tour and was booked at Summer View Hotel. The great thing about this hotel is its location. The well known Bugis Street is just about 5 minutes walk! Little India is nearby and so are the other techy stores. It is a bit pricey but this is Singapore! Hotels here are so expensive! But the room I got had windows. That is the best part of it coz some hotels here don't have windows. The room is also clean. And yes, there's a bathtub too. The food.... well, it's just average.... not much to choose from... and it does get boring as the days pass by coz the menu doesn't change. The staff, well what can I say... friendly and unbelievable service! I maybe be biased a bit coz I had surprises thrown on me during my stay. :-) The concierge guy, an old man ( I forgot his name) was super kind and helpful! Check-in and check-out is a breeze! Special thanks to Mel (front desk staff) for making my stay at Summer View a sweet and memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeerajVic
Reviews.Content: Good location, slightly costly, overall fine.Rooms clean, bathroom congested slightly.

Reviews.Title: “Well alternaty in High end Singapore”
Reviews.Author: CSTOEHR
Reviews.Content: While looking for rooms to stay less then 100€ i found this SUMMER VIEW Hotel. In fact, it's a reasonable room quality, it's small but incl. TV. Internet cost extra but the breakfast is included so overall i like it very much for Business stays. It's near convencion center (Exhibition center) so the distance by Taxi is very near. It is easy to reach and some shows and restaurants around, what do we need else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Only if on Tight Budget”
Reviews.Author: AmarKhanna
Reviews.Content: I been on a real tight budget and had to stick to select Summer View Hotel in Bugis Area. Will surely not recommend, as we'd got IBIS just across the street within the same price range. Breakfast served was not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Within your reach”
Reviews.Author: blue_eyes07
Reviews.Content: Whatever you need is within your reach... restaurants, shopping, electronic shops, night market, MRT is just a minutes walk away... Rooms are clean, food at breakfast is good and very helpful staff...

Reviews.Title: “small room, but good location”
Reviews.Author: astiarjan
Reviews.Content: this is a 3* hotel, rooms are small but clean, i reserved for twin bedroom and get triple bedroom :) breakfast is standard at the coffee house, but what we like mostly is that the location is walking distance to Indian food court, across the street a chinese food court. for guests who plan to go to Universal Studio, can go to front desk and buy shuttle bus ticket SGD15/person. bus leaves every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: timmy8oy
Reviews.Content: Small room, pretty grotty and outdated, fine if it was cheap but it wasn`t, not when the Ibis across the street is the same money and a million times better. That said the staff were great and the place was clean, too clean in fact, it reeked of disinfectant. Breakfast was OK, good location and bearable for one night, the porter was a lazy so and so and might as well have not been there. To be fair they were very flexible and friendly, I just feel they charged too much for the level of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Quick Stopover”
Reviews.Author: davidtjm Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and efficient and the room although small was comfortable. The aircon worked okay and the breakfasts were good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: geminitraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked 5 rooms at this hotel for our group. The staff was very helpful during our entire stay. The rooms though were quite on the small side. All our rooms on the 3rd floor didn't have any window so it was quite scary thinking what could have happened in case there was a fire. I have never stayed in a windowless hotel before. Some of the tvs in the rooms were a small 14 inches so it was an effort to watch shows. Breakfast was basic and the same throughout our 3-day stay. Wi-fi is also quite expensive inside the hotel but there is an internet shop beside it that charges SGD1 for an hour. Good thing, taxis stop in front of the hotel so it was convenient. The hotel is also walking distance to the metro, Bugis and many other tourist places. But for an addtional price, I'd probably stay at Ibis Hotel right across this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We feel like staying in a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: couple06
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel and our room was on the 5th floor. The room was very small and with an additional extra bed we almost couldn't even move in it. The toilet flush was also in a poor condition. Fortunately,we found the staffs are very friendly and polite as well. The location was also the value of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very clean!”
Reviews.Author: chaos1785
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from September 30 to October 3, 2010 with a friend for a mini vacation. The hotel is very basic but the staff were very nice and helpful. There was no problem with check in. My friend had arranged the booking before we left for Singapore and there were no problems when we arrived at the hotel and we were brought to our room right away. The room was very small and even though there was a window, it had no view since the window looked out to another wall. There was a small TV but no cable and the only decent channel to watch was Channel News Asia. But why spend all day in the hotel room watching tv when you're on vacation right? There was also a mini fridge but nothing inside - for you to use if you'd like to buy your own water, food, etc. from the 7-11 right across the street. We had two single beds which were ok in size, clean and quite comfy. The bathroom was very clean too! There was soap in a soap dispenser by the sink and shampoo in a dispenser in the shower. The shower is kind of small but no complaints as the water pressure of the shower was very strong. They also served daily breakfasts at the Thai restaurant in the hotel but we never got to try any of it. With so much good food in Singapore though I wouldn't want to be eating Thai in the restaurant. In terms of location, it is about a 5 minute walk to Bugis St. and Bugis Junction where the closest MRT station is. There is also a bus stop across the street and a taxi stand right outside the hotel. Just up the road a bit is Sim Lim Square where you can check out electronics and a food court at the basement with really good chicken rice for only SGD3.50. We didn't use the hotel internet but I don't think there was WIFI. I saw 2 computers in the lobby though that I think guests can use, though I don't know if there is a fee. There are a lot of internet cafes nearby for quite cheap (up to SGD2/hour). Also up the street are hawker type places too! Overall, this hotel was ok. If you want a clean place just to sleep in, then Summer View is an ok hotel. But I think there are better hotels which are bigger for the same or even a lower price. Thumbs up for cleanliness and the friendly staff though!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kalmy1961
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and were very disappointed with it.Our room was a twin, the portable TV was to the side of the beds so had to be turned to be viewed but as it was so small you couldnt read the writing or see the picture clearly.The air con couldnt be adjusted you either had it freezing or turned it off....we did both throughout the night..the bathroom was squishy..the toilet behind the door that didnt always flush well.The bath was so high i fell out the first night because i couldnt reach the ground..There was only 1 extra blanket for 2 beds..The breakfast included was below standard serving cold scrambled eggs watered down orange juice and only 1 choice of spreads.The lift had no air con and was very stuffy.We had cleaners knocking on our door at 8.30 to clean...bit much when shops dont open till 11 and you want to lie in and relax On a positive note the location was very good being close electronics complex..Bugis Junction..Little India and a short drive to Chinatown. The bell hops were very helpful and very polite. Would i stay there again? Only if i was desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not good”
Reviews.Author: Abeer71
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the hotel was arranged by Singapore Airlines. We reached at 5 in the morning. and the hotel gave us one room for six people since the package was supposed to be started from next day. they arranged the other room at 12. the rooms were very small but clean. The breakfast room was also small with fewer items. The location of the hotel is not good. In the evening you will find nothing outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HoochDarwin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was near to local food courts, great for the budget traveller, who likes to eat locally. It was also close to some nice restaurants if you wanted to go a bit more up market. It was in walking distance to the MRT, Orchid Road and a bus stop was across the road. The rooms where old but clean, BUT be aware not all rooms are the same size, some of them seemed quite small. We noticed this as we walked pass rooms that where being cleaned. The negative on this hotel was the restaurant that breakfast was served in, it was too small to cope with the numbers and it was hard to find a table to sit at, in the end we took ours back to the room to eat it, which was not ideal. HoochDarwin

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean room, honest and accomodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: galesan
Reviews.Content: My second time on this hotel just a stop over from London Heathrow to Manila. Unfortunately, I accidentally left my blackberry mobile inspite checking everything before I check out. I only knew it when I was already in the taxi going to the airport so I asked the taxi driver to go back. As soon as I arrived they knew that I left something and they give it to me after asking my personal details to make sure they give it the right person.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sebastjan
Reviews.Content: We have been in Singapore in March the second time. And we choose this hotel because is situated on the excellent location. The price for Singapore in quite low ....and for this reason you can not expect an perfect hotel.....you will get include in the price a breakfast too. The rooms are not so big but if you need a hotel only to sleep is ok. When I will visit Singapore again I will chose this hotel again because the location is perfect.....10min walk to the MRT, 1min walk to food market, 2min walk to Buggis market , 20min walk to Clarke Quay..... Let's say low price for a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, very good location”
Reviews.Author: kegler747
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is its greatest asset. If you love to shop electronics then Sim Lim Square is just a stone throw's away. Even though the rooms are small it is clean as what you expect in a very clean city. The buffet breakfast is filling although the choices are limited. We arrived at about 10am and the front desk staff gladly gave us our room with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Small yet Usefull”
Reviews.Author: Kartikk
Reviews.Content: My stay at Summer View was predesigned with a specific travel plan in mind. 1. I didn't want to spend a bomb 2.In the city 3 Clean place With these in mind and reading some of the reviews mentioned by fellow travelers I decided to book this place and take the plunge I wasnt surprised by the results either, as people have mentioned above its a decent place but has its own set of cons. We were put into a deluxe room, but for the size it everything else was ....Ok. The rooms are clean, it was on the 8th floor and pretty quite. The best part of this place is not the hotel itself but the location and you have almost everything around you, Sim-Lim Square for electronics, lil India, Buguis Village and the MRT. so with that in mind I think its good enough place to stay for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and strategic location”
Reviews.Author: lolithuerto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near shopping areas that offer inexpensive goods. These areas include Bugis junction, Mustafa (less than 5SGD cab fare), Chinatown (1SGD bus fare), Sim Lim Square, OG, etc. The room may not be very large but it's very clean; although I prefer a room with a window. The staff members are very polite and friendly especially ms. jazmin of the front desk. The rate is reasonable considering that it already includes a buffet breakfast; although I hope that there are more food variations. Given the chance to go back to Singapore, I would like to stay at Summer View Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “TIDY ROOM BUT NOT ENOUGH”
Reviews.Author: JENGWOON
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine and good : location, clean room, water ok . service soso, staffs helpful ....But we still felt not enogh. not the same Uk. hotel frefer asian guests than uk oraneriacans ... Hotel was ok and good inn different style

Reviews.Title: “Offset other views”
Reviews.Author: Twoblue61
Reviews.Content: We are there now. Yes the room is small.-but, it is clean, has good water pressure in bathroom (not like UK), bed is comfortable and the hotel is in a great location. Staff have been helpful incl the concierge. They allowed us to check in 3 hours in advance of the nominated time (great after a 15 hour flight). Air con works perfectly ensuring a good night sleep. Breakfast selections is not extensive but they cover Eastern and Western tastes. What do you expect for a reasonable low tariff

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: CRobo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for one night whilst on a stopover to Cambodia. Located in a very good area not to far from the beginning of the Orchard Road, and about a 15 minute walk from the Metro station. Room itself was very basic, but clean and comfortable. TV had poor reception. Breakfast was part of the package, but I did not have a chance to sample this due to an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean, but very small rooms,would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Martine062
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Summer view in November. It was $135 a night which included breakfast.At first I was not impressed as they had my husband and I in a twin room. However they moved us straight away. The room was very small with a small cupboard to put your luggage in and only enough room for side tables each side. The room had a window but it looked out on to the building. The bathroom was small with the toilet behind the door and the door opening onto the bath/shower, which was quite high to get into (I am a short person). The room was nice and clean and the aircon worked a treat as it was quite muggy outside. The breakfast was in a small cafe nextdoor small buffet style with a mix match of dishes including chips and very squishy with everyone moving past. However for the price and location I would stay there again. But not if you wanted a 4 or 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Summer view”
Reviews.Author: PampasThane
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is good. However, the rooms are terrible. The rooms are so small that if you keep your bag there is no place for you to stand. Most of the rooms do not have a window. Hence, once you are in the room, you would not know whether it is day or night outside. The bathroom was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Little India and Sim Lim square”
Reviews.Author: RG1Mumbai
Reviews.Content: It is a budget hotel but with good value for money. Complimentary breakfast is good. Rooms are a little cramped but if you are a tourist you would be out most of the time. Little India and Sim Lim aquare (for electronics) is at a stone's throw. Bugis junction and MRT is also very close. Bugis village is quite happenning in the evenings so that can be enjoyed. Over all, good centrally located hotel for budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Only if You're on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: Sotsotone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Summerview for only 1 night because the hotel which we were staying in few nights earlier (Ibis Bencoolen) was sold out on the promotional rate for that particular Saturday. With a budget of SGD 100-130 the most, our options were limited to either Hotel 81 Bencoolen or Summerview Hotel, and we finally chose Summerview Hotel after reading some of the reviews, and because it was the closest to Ibis (directly opposite the road). Room size is okay (not as small as expected), and generally clean - except the toilet and bath tub which were turning moldy, with patches of cement "filings" here and there. In addition, room is not soundproof and we were kept awake at night by the late-night "activities" next door. Breakfast was really simple - the simplest breakfast we've ever had in any hotels before. Strange thing was they actually labelled the drinks for "breakfast only" and "reserved for lunch/dinner buffet". A better alternative was to just refill the drinks after the breakfast buffet instead of restricting guests to only one side of the drinks table. Verdict: Will prefer to choose another hotel when staying in Singapore next time especially with the less-than-welcoming attitude of the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for 'professional' tourists”
Reviews.Author: PlunderBunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Summerview hotel for six nights. The location is reasonably good - the Bugis street MRT station is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. In Singapore, this is about the distance you can walk without starting to sweat provided you're young and reasonably fit. A 24-hour supermarket is close by and there are food courts and restaurants within a 5 minute walking distance. We requested a non-smoking twin share room with a window. The room (or indeed the hotel) didn't smell smoky, and the room was clean and odour free. The view from the window was of the backs of surrounding buildings - not as bad as a brick wall 3 feet away, but not scenic either. We were on the 8th (top) floor however - the view further down would be worse. Note that the hotel does have some rooms without windows, so make sure you specify that you want a window to avoid feeling like you're in a dungeon. The hotel seemed reasonably quiet at night, although again this may be different on the lower floors. There was a notice stating that guests weren't permitted after 10pm (to keep the ladies of the night away) - we certainly didn't see any. Note: The trip-advisor hotel facilities icons indicate that there's a swimming pool. I didn't see one (although I didn't know to look for it). Given the building size, I find it doubtful that there is a pool. The furnishing in the room and the hotel generally were starting to show their age - the decor might have been fashionable in the 1970's! The bed sheets and towels were clean, and the carpet appeared clean enough, although it looked like it might have had some stains in the past. There were several minor complaints: The door handle for the bathroom wasn't working properly, making it hard to open. The remote control for the TV didn't work, and the TV itself was a small (22 inch?) CRT which only received about 10 channels with reasonable reception. The shower was very difficult to adjust to a steady temperature - most of the time it produced either cool or scalding hot water. Service was reasonable, which appears to equate to 'good' relative to other people's experiences of Singapore Hotels! Free wireless internet is provided, although I didn't try it so I can't comment on reliability. Overall, we found the room to be adequate. It wasn't fancy by any stretch of the imagination, but it was clean, and tidy. If a hotel room is simply a place to have a shower and sleep, you will be satisfied, but if you want anything beyond rudimentary you'll have to look elsewhere. In the week that we stayed, the new Hotel Ibis opened directly across the road. According to a TV news story, the room rates started at S$148, similar to what we paid to stay in Summerview hotel, and the rooms looked much nicer. Although this rate is probably introductory, I feel Summerview hotel will nevertheless have to either quickly drop its rates, or spruce up its rooms a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tshirtontour
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Summerview Hotel. The hotel is located on Bencoolen street which is a long wide street with a one way traffic flow – left to right. The street has shops, restaurants and hotels running down it sides and the area is worth a browse. The area is safe to walk around at all times. The Summerview hotel fronts out onto Bencoolen street. Out of the hotel entrance, turn left and walk a few minutes to a set of traffic lights. Cross here and you are into Bugis which is a lively market and shopping area. The hotel is not central to Orchard Road which is the main street in Singapore. It would be a thirty minute walk from the hotel but with the MRT and bus service nearby getting to Orchard Road is easy enough to achieve. A ten minute walk from the hotel will bring you to Bugis MRT station via Bugis market. There is a taxi stand outside the hotel so hailing a cab is not a hassle. The hotel lobby is compact and bright. The corridors and elevators were clean. The hotel carpet has seen better times and could do with replacing. Check in is done without any fuss and you will find the staff competent. The reception staff appear to be not open to small talk but maybe it a language issue rather than being impolite. The hotel housekeeping staff are very friendly and go out of their way to bid you good morning. Our room was located on the firth floor and comments are based on our allocated room. The room was small but fine for two persons. It had a good size bed, a desk, two chairs and a large wardrobe. Furniture was in good condition but dated. There was a small fridge in the room which was in a clean condition. The television set in the room was small and carried local channels. There is a tea/coffee making facilities in the room but if you like regular tea/coffee it would be wise to bring your own tea bags/coffee sachets as you are only given two tea bags/coffee sachets and a charge will incur if you request more. The bathroom was compact and spotless. Because of its size only one person could use the bathroom at one time unless the other person was taking a shower. The water supply was good and hot water was always available. The bathtub is very high so care has to be taken stepping out of it. The shower controls were low on the wall so operating the water temperature dials can be tricky if the water is flowing. One thing to be mindful of is that at the entrance to the bathroom there is a low step. If you forget the step as you enter/exit the bathroom you will almost certainly stub your toe or worse, trip. Towels are supplied and changed daily. Housekeeping is prompt and very efficient. Even though our room was on the fifth floor and facing the road we were not troubled by traffic noise. The hotel itself is quiet at night aside from the usual hotel corridor traffic. Breakfast is served in the D’Lemon Tree café which is adjacent to the hotel reception. On checking in you are given breakfast coupons which can be redeemed at the café. Breakfast is served 7.30am to 10.00am but after 9.30am food supply decreases. Getting a table can be struggle if the breakfast rush is on which appears to be from 8.45am onwards. Breakfast is buffet style and for such a large hotel is very small and limited. It offers four hot items, tea/coffee, juice, toast (which you make yourself) and fresh fruit. Overall, the breakfast on offer is average but it fills the void until you next meal. Remember, in Singapore you are only a plate throw away from food so you will never go hungry. The Summerview attracts mature couples and families so there is nice friendly vibe in the hotel. If you are looking for a no-frills, safe and well located hotel the Summerview fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellers56
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Breakpoint
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Summer View Hotel on a recent business trip to Singapore. The hotel is clean, conveniently located to the Suntec Convention Center, and is reasonably priced. It does not have most of the amenities that come with the much larger hotels in Singapore. The bathroom lighting is poor. There is no light above the sink, which makes it hard to shave! The staff is pleasant, but not so helpful. I had difficulty getting change at the front desk (twice) when I wanted to break a $50 bill for cab fares. I had a package shipped to the hotel, but they never informed me that it had arrived, and had no record of receiving it. I found the package when I looked for it myself. The breakfast that you have the option to include with the price of the room is very basic, and disappointing from my experience with other Asian hotels. Breakfast consists of fried eggs, a noodle or rice dish, hot dogs, and baked beans. The potato product is sometimes french fries or a hash brown cake. Coffee, juice, toast are also available. Since I was on business it was a conveniently located, clean hotel that was inexpensive. So I was not unhappy with the overall experience, but I might try another hotel though on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MVLVA
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located, good facilities

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: austinDelhi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel summerview for 3 days during trip to singapore in august . It is a small but beautiful hotel with very dedicated staff and a very good restaurant.Moreover this hotel is located very close to places like little india.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: mistyManila
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive to book in this hotel due to some bad reviews. But since the price is affordable and the location is good we took the risk. We did not regret it. Ofcourse you cannot compare it with the 5 or 4 star hotels. But overall we we not disappointed. The room was clean. The bedsheets where clean and crisp. new towels daily. Breakfast buffet is good. And the location is really great- one bus ride away from vivo city (that connects to sentosa), to suntec center, to orchard, little india. The room is indeed small but if you're going to spend the whole day outside, then its no big deal. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: aycs
Reviews.Content: Located on busy Bencoolen Street, the Summer View hotel is a very central hotel with all forms of public transport nearby. With a taxi stand and a bus stop right outside the front doors and the Bugis MRT station a casual 10 minute walk away, the hotel's location certainly served out purposes well. Checking in was very quick and we were suprised to find that the hotel had placed our 4 rooms very close to each other (including an adjoining door for ourselves and another travel companion). We were also located on the 8th floor which is the highest, but there were no great views from our bedroom or the hallway windows. We were given a standard room, which came with a double bed and some modest furnishing, including a small TV (which had several local and international channels - no movies though), a couple of chairs and a small table and desk. There wasn't a lot of room to swing a cat, but we didn't expect much as we really were looking for a place that was in a good location and was reasonable in price and clean, which it was. The bathroom was a bit of a struggle. The bath/shower was very deep, which meant that you had to be careful every time you stepped out of the bath, and I imagine that if you were not exactly fit and agile, you might find it a bit of a struggle. The toilet was located behind the bathroom door, which meant that every time you wanted to use it, you had to do a bit of a dance to get around the door. The hotel also uses shampoo and soap dispensers, rather than little vials and boxes for your conveniences. Breakfast was provided every morning, but after the first morning, we preferred to go out and have breakfast elsewhere. The restaurant is a very small place and just about every morning we walked past (including the first morning where we waited a little while for a table) there were always people waiting around. The breakfast selection was also very minimal, although they did have the usual toast, cereal, baked beans, and a variety of local dishes including noodles and rice. As the hotel is not very big, we did not encounter a lot of staff so I cannot comment on their service too much. But housekeeping was fine - they cleaned and tidied the room everytime we left the sign up and checking out was again a very swift experience. There was some renovations going on whilst we were there, but it rarely disturbed us as we were very rarely back in our room during the day. We had some issues with our air-conditioner. The coldest we could set it was about 20 degrees and any amount of adjusting or tinkering didn't change the temperature. And since it wasn't an unbearable temperature, we just decided to put up with it. As I mentioned at the beginning, the hotel is very well located. For all the computer and electronic geeks, Sim Lim is located only a 2 minute walk away and for the serious bargain hunter, Bugis market is only a 5 minute walk away. And if you're after a bit of air-conditioning shopping and a few more name brand stores, Bugis Junction is only located another few minutes further (along with the MRT station). Summer View hotel simply did the job for our 10 day stay and the experience pretty much lived up to our expectations. We didn't expect something grand or fancy, just somthing well located, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “"Not great..."”
Reviews.Author: SL1605
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights, 3 girls, at the Summer View Hotel after a short trip to Kuala Lumpur. Very good location, near major shopping malls. But rooms are small, toilet flush not working properly. Staff not very friendly. We had to bring down our luggage by ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: honestned
Reviews.Content: OK if you like tiny rooms, filthy corridors that smell like a hospital, dirty floors and someone else's long hairs in your bathroom, traffic noise at night, meeting prostitutes and their clients in the hotel lobby and corridors (one even knocked on our door in the middle of the night!), vinyl covered mattresses and disposable pillowcases (or is that a plus?) and having breakfast in the dark, smoky nightclub area. There also seemed to be about six staff chatting behind the front desk at any time of day, though they were generally polite and helpful. - maybe some of them should have been put to use cleaning up the rooms and corridors?

Reviews.Title: “Summer View Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CasparLondon
Reviews.Content: The only recommendation I can make for the Summer View Hotel is its central location. On arrival we found our standard twin room extremely shabby and the bathroom dirty. We were upgraded to a "De Luxe" double bedroom which was marginally better. The standard of this room was less than "Travel Lodge" standard. The included buffet breakfast was poor, and we ate out after the first morning. If we hadn't pre-paid for our three nights I wouldn't have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Bare Essentials at a cost”
Reviews.Author: ilocanotraveller
Reviews.Content: I've been in better hotels, at the same price, in places like Kuala Lumpur and Macau. If you can get in Allson or City Bayview, go ahead, since they are nearer to Orchard Road than Summer View. The nearest attraction to the hotel is the Singapore National Museum, which is around 5 minutes down Bencoolen Street. The nearest MRT station is around 7 minutes. This would be the Bugis station which runs along the East-West Line (the line going to Changi Airport). It is a very small hotel next to Burlington Plaza and Sim Lim IT Mall. I reserved for a double room. When my fiancee and I arrived, we got a twin room. I only got my double room after the 2nd day. The room was the smallest I've been in to (for the same price I paid in other countries). No windows. Low bed. Small tv with very limited channels. On the bright side, the room has the bare essentials. Clean bathroom. Continuous hot water. Cool airconditioner. And a substantial compliance bed. If you're going to spend the day going around singapore, and only need a place to shower and sleep in, this is an option. If you want comfort, pampering and expect to stay in the room, I don't recommend Summer View.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor value”
Reviews.Author: Voyager1225
Reviews.Content: Okay, Singapore is not a great value for 3 star hotels anymore. For US$96/night we expected what their website said: "100 designer furnished guest rooms. All rooms are fully carpeted and tastefully furnished..." Ours was anything but. Very small, terribly worn and stained, felt grimy, smelled musty, and very limited TV channels (they say they have satellite, but satellite is actually illegal in SIN). Shampoo was in a broken dispenser on the wall. Breakfast highly mediocre. Pricey wireless - we went two doors down to a friendly and inexpensive internet cafe. Staff not unpleasant but not helpful either. Next time we'll bump up our budget a bit and seek out someplace more. If we were backpackers and aligned our expectations as such, this would have been fine. But we were on a long weekend holiday and this was no place to spend even a minute of extra time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: porty1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, staff excellent and nothing was a problem for them. Daily maid service. Room immaculate. Lemon Thai restaurant where you had breakfast, good food and again friendly efficient staff. Hotel is good value for money and very close to shops. 10-15 minutes walk to Orchard Rd - end to end shopping,10 minute walk to the famous Raffles Hotel, recommend the Singapore Sling in the Long Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of My Life”
Reviews.Author: JTayKL
Reviews.Content: My stay at Summer View was a terrible experience and I will be writing an official letter to the hotel management regarding the bad service as well as the outrageous attitude of one of their service staff at the reception. Her name is Mya. The hotel was recommended by our travel agent due to its great location and 3 star rating. We were also informed that it was supposed to be a new hotel, and its standards similar to the Allson Hotel. Based on my travel experience, I strongly feel that Summerview does not deserve the 3 star rating, mainly because the facilities' conditions are terrible and the rooms are not "designed guest rooms" as stated on their website. Most importantly, however, we were not treated well as guests. For example, it took around 15 rings before the hotel's operator would pick up our call and whatever we requested never arrived at our room. In addition, I was asked to carry my own big suitcase to my room when I checked in because the hotel did not have any porters at 2300. Upon my check out at 0730 on Sunday, when we called for a porter, the phone was answered rudely by Mya (after almost 10 rings) who asked my elderly parents and I to carry our own bags (in total, 10 bags). She also wanted to know how many people there were in our party and had the audacity to suggest that we could always go up and down the lifts, carrying the luggage, two pieces at a time since there was no porter at that time ! Although we understand that certain hotels do not employ 24-hour porters, we do expect their staff to assist us in other ways, such as providing trolleys etc for our use. When I explained our predicament to Mya, she still refused to suggest any other ways to assist us and insisted that we carry our own bags (despite the fact that I had already earlier explained to her that I had 10 pieces of luggage, elderly parents and two very young children). Her most discourteous reply was, everyone carried their own bags in the hotel, so why couldn't we do the same?? The worst part of our experience was definitely the treatment accorded by Mya. When we complained that the service was bad, she said that she did not need our business, as the hotel was always full with guests from other countries and she didn't need business from Malaysians. In addition, she has also verbally abused my father, calling him "kurang ajar" which means "ill-bred". When we asked to speak to the manager, she then informed us that she is the person in charge there and is equivalent to a Manager at that time. She was constantly trying to verbally abuse my father during the entire ordeal and it was embarassing as there were other guests in the lobby at that time. Another receptionist was there at that time by the name of Wendy and she quickly ushered Mya to the back office and tried to calm my parents because as they were extremely traumatised by the incident and Mya's outrageous behaviour. I will be writing to the hotel management and also copy the said letter to the Singapore Ministry of Tourism to report the incident. We have no doubt that the hotel location is very good and although we have acknowledged that that certain facilities are not up to par, at the very least the service accorded by the hotel's staff should have made up for its shortcomings. Much to the contrary, we were subject to the likes of Mya, whose behaviour was inexcusable, and should be subjected to disciplinary action which I hope the management will take against her, for the sake of the reputation of the Summer View hotel. This experience really spoilt our holiday in Singapore and I would certainly never recommend the hotel to anyone who wants a good time in Singapore. This is one of the worst hotels that my family and I have ever stayed in, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Tourist Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goodpace
Reviews.Content: If you want a really clean, efficiently run tourist class hotel, this is an excellent choice. I was there for four nights and found it to be a great value with a price of $75 USD net /night I got online. The room was adequate and well maintained. The air conditioning worked well and the shower was excellent. It is not luxury, but it is functionally pleasing. There are many great Indian and Chinese hawkers easily within walking distance. Bugis MRT station is a ten minute walk. Clarke Quay and Boat Quay were about a twenty mintue walk. Getting taxis in the evening can be a pain, so have the hotel call for one and pay the extra few dollar surcharge. The included breakfast at the Thai restaurant attached was sufficient, but not extraordinary. Hotel staff was helpful and efficient. From my experience, to upgrade to the next class of hotel in Singapore would cost another $75-100 USD. I really felt like I got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for the price great location”
Reviews.Author: prong263
Reviews.Content: I read so many bad reports about this hotel,But decided to check it out for myself.I stayed for two nights and I was very surprised, I will definitely stay there again. I have been to Singapore many times and always tried a new hotel mainly 4 star. The location is great close to MRT station and all the food centres The room was nice and clean and airconditioning worked well great friendly staff eager to help, give it a try great value.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: pekoray
Reviews.Content: My family and myself stayed at the Summer View in July on our way home from a 5 week trip to the U.K and Europe. This hotel was booked by our Travel Agent, we told her we wanted a resonable priced hotel in a area close to Orchard Road for shopping. We arrived after a 15 hour flight, from Rome to London and London to Singapore. The room we were given had the air conditioner vent falling out of the ceiling, a broken shower head, and the dirtiest sheets we have ever seen on all 3 beds. To make matters worse we did not even have a window in the room, only a picture of a beach with a light behind, if by the smallest of chances you may want to light up. This was by far the worst hotel we have ever stayed at. A hot cooked breakfast was included in the room rate. This was a restaurant next door owned by the hotel, it consisted of a big bowl of what you could call slop with greasy bits of meat floating on top, with dried fried eggs on the side weatermelon and tea or coffee if you wanted, we did not. We ate all our meals down the road at the Rendezous Hotel, which we could recommend as being very good.The only thing this Hotel had going for it was close to Orchard Road shops, and the girls on the reception desk down stairs were very nice. But do not stay if you want a nice holiday or even a nice stop over between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: whizforty
Reviews.Content: Summer View is on Bencoolen St which is a great location. However, the hotel was much below average with rooms which are real small. Seemed extreamly shabby and poor service. I guess its truly a back packers hotel. We were so disappointed that we shifted hotels to Rendezvous which was absolutely superb. This is the first time that we went wrong with online hotel reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location.”
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Hotel is average, rooms are very small, beds are not so clean, tv is smaller than my laptop's screen. Staff, however are very good. But it is what to expect for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “I hope they check the bathrooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: gandagirl
Reviews.Content: Rooms (specifically 303 and 304) were shabby! Toilet doesn't flush properly and water is leaking continuously down the bowl. What a waste! Location is excellent but you want a good night sleep and awhen you dog tired from all that shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location”
Reviews.Author: tel5521
Reviews.Content: Was apprehensive about staying there for a week after reading some of the reviews on here. But was realistic enough not to expect the Raffles at 2 star prices ! Good value, clean rooms & bathrooms, friendly staff ( no 'grumpies' evident !), wholesome if unexciting breakfasts but not enough to make me eat elsewhere. I would stay there again - I guess we're just too easily pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nungky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Summerview Hotel for 3 nights with my family. The room were small but clean. The bathroom was spotless. The big "plus" about this budget hotel is its location, within walking distance to Bugis, the shops and MRT. We would recommended this budget hotel and will be staying here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Icy service”
Reviews.Author: bonketoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 1 night at the Summerview after a reservation mixup caused us to have to leave the Perak hotel one day early. I must say I found the front desk service uniformly icy. They spoke very sparingly. No smiles or any evidence of friendliness. Room was on the small side and had a strange smell. Decor was early 80's. The bath towels, while big and fluffy, had a strange odor as well. My wife preferred to air-dry after her shower rather than use these smelly towels. Breakfast was adequate but a bit strange with baked beans and hot dog segments. Overall I would not recommend the Summerview hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will make it simple. This is a budget hotel so do not expect any special service from the staff. If you simply need a room to stay while in Singapore then consider the Summer View Hotel. The rooms are very clean and the beds are alright, definitely well worth the money. Forget about the breakfast. Instead go outside and enjoy the local food. There are plenty of restaurants around and the area is great (Bugis). You can even walk to Orchard road if you like (15mins – 20mins) or use the nearby MRT. This is an ideal location if you are a vegetarian like me. There are so many full vegetarian restaurants in the area partly inspired by the ‘Goddess of Mercy’ temple just opposite the hotel. The whole area has good vibes and it’s very pleasant at night. Almost like a little china town. Ask for a room with view (facing the temple), otherwise you might end up without a window or facing the car park. Overall this hotel is worth it if you are on a budget (quality is above average for the price). The cleaning crew is very good and the hotel seems well taken care of. I usually stay in Orchard road and not in budget hotels. Staying in Bugis this time was great for a change and I find this hotel well worth the price and can only recommend it! There is no luxury but you have all you need and again…It’s clean!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but even for this money better hotel(s) may be found in SNG”
Reviews.Author: Pepetito
Reviews.Content: Not expensive, service not attentive & even rude, room similar to pen-box by size - hardly 2 people may be contained inside. But... the location is just great, near to everything in SNG: 3min to tube station, 5min to Orchard. However we regret not to take some 2-3* boutique hotel like "1929", which is sort of 10 SNG bucks more only.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: maverick001
Reviews.Content: I visited Singapore during a the busy Asia Aerospace weekend. Most of the 3-star hotels were fully booked and I had to settle for this hotel. The usual room rate is S$90 per night and I had to pay a surcharge of S$20 per night. Rooms: Rooms were not big; but pretty functional. My room was on the 4th floor with a queen size bed. The window faces the duct. The room and toilets were clean and housekeeping was okay. No toiletries provided (except the liquid soap). A tiny TV, complimetary coffee/tea making facility and mini-refrigerator is also provided. Breakfast: Breakfast was included. You get toast, butter, peach-jam, egg, sausage, rice/noodles, coffee, tea, fresh cut fruits and fruit juice. I'd rate it okay-for-a-budget-place. Location: The hotel is next to Sim Lim Square and Burlington Mall. Access to MRT is a problem. Bugis MRT is a 7 min walk; Little India MRT is 8 mins walk and Dhoby Ghaut Interchange is 15-20 mins walk. In Singapore's hot and humid climate, this can be taxing at times. Access from Airport: On arrival, we took the MRT from Changi Airport to Bugis followed by a short walk to the hotel. On departure, we took the taxi service provided by the Hotel. It was a Merc Van and could comfortably seat 4 of us and carried all our luggage. (Cost: S$35) Overall Analysis: A good place if you are looking for budget accomodation. You should be able to get a double room for S$80-S$90. In that respect its value for money. Would I stay here again: Not likely. I'd rather prefer some 3-star hotel very close to an MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BritDownUnder
Reviews.Content: I had no particular problems with this hotel. I didn't pay much to stay there, so guess I couldn't expect too much in the way of luxuries! My room had 2 single beds, which were not very big. I thought I was going to fall out in the night! There was a small TV in the room which was in a strange position, on a shelf around the corner from the sleeping area. Breakfast wasn't great, I didn't bother with the cooked items as they didn't look a tempting combination, so it was just tea, toast and melon for me. On the positive side, the hotel was in a good location, within walking distance of Little India, Orchard road and with a metro station 5-10 min walk away.
